case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Near complete or complete skeleton
case_address_found_1: Near Big Sand Creek on Elk Summit Road
case_circumstances: Remains found near an abandoned camp site in a remote area of Idaho County near Montana border.  Closest major highway is US 12.  Evidence and latest UNT forensic indicate remains were approx. 2 years old when found.
case_head_hair: hair found on some of the clothing indicates a head hair color of blonde to blondish-red in color.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: Maroon pullover shirt with light brown horizontal stripe; light brown imitation leather jacket, size medium manufactured by "Anthonys".
case_clothing_with_body: Green (possible army fatigue pants with a possible inseam of 30"); Shirt of unknown manufacturer made of blue wool with gray & black buttons; dark blue military style web belt with "Domar U.S." on back of the buckle (possible waist of 32").
case_footwear: white tennis shoes (made is USA, size approx. 10-12.5).  Most likely brand is PF Flyers of a type issued by military.
case_eyewear: wire rimmed glasses indicating victim was very near-sighted.
case_other_items_with_body: white plastic water bottle with blue cap.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
